about: If you're considering a Privacy Engineer role at Sophos, the global leader in cybersecurity, here's what such a job might involve based on industry trends and Sophos's focus on data security.
description:
Key Responsibilities

  1. Privacy by Design:

    • Embed privacy features into Sophos products and services from inception.

    • Develop solutions ensuring compliance with global privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).

  2. Data Protection:

    • Implement mechanisms to secure sensitive data, such as anonymization, encryption, and secure storage.

    • Monitor and ensure adherence to data lifecycle management best practices.

  3. Compliance Support:

    • Assist legal and compliance teams in conducting privacy impact assessments (PIAs) and data protection impact assessments (DPIAs).

    • Work closely with the Data Protection Officer (DPO) to address privacy concerns.

  4. Technology Development:

    • Design and implement privacy-enhancing technologies (PETs) for Sophos products.

    • Collaborate with software engineers to build scalable, privacy-compliant features.

  5. Monitoring and Auditing:

    • Conduct regular audits to identify privacy risks in systems and processes.

    • Develop metrics and reporting dashboards to track privacy compliance.

  6. Education and Advocacy:

    • Train employees on privacy-related best practices.

    • Advocate for privacy principles across the organization.

Why Work at Sophos?

  • Mission-Driven: Sophos is a trusted name in cybersecurity, protecting millions of users and businesses worldwide.

  • Cutting-Edge Technology: Opportunity to work with advanced AI and cloud-based security solutions.

  • Innovative Environment: A culture that encourages innovation and teamwork.

  • Global Impact: Play a vital role in safeguarding user privacy and data security at scale.

about: We are looking for a skilled Cybersecurity Analyst to join our team and help safeguard our organization against cyber threats. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in security best practices, a keen eye for vulnerabilities, and the ability to respond to incidents effectively.
description:
As a Cybersecurity Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in detecting, preventing, and mitigating cyber threats. You will monitor systems, identify vulnerabilities, and implement measures to protect sensitive data.

Responsibilities:

  • Monitor security alerts and respond to incidents promptly.

  • Conduct vulnerability assessments and penetration testing.

  • Implement and maintain firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and anti-virus solutions.

  • Collaborate with IT teams to address security gaps and risks.

  • Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.

  • Develop and execute security protocols and policies.

  • Create and present reports detailing security incidents and mitigation strategies.

  • Train employees on cybersecurity best practices and emerging threats.

Qualifications and Skill Sets:

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.

  • 2-5 years of experience in cybersecurity or related roles.

  • Proficiency in tools like SIEM (e.g., Splunk, QRadar), firewalls, and endpoint protection.

  • Strong knowledge of cryptography, ethical hacking techniques, and network security.

  • Industry certifications such as CEH, CISSP, or CompTIA Security+ preferred.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

  • Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively.
